intro: Grausa micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered grausa, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial herb native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant features opposite, simple leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in cymes, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Grausa micrantha is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
